R56RvRvyJJsMw-RokB6OIA.text: Clearly states delivery...think twice. Get the social media facts straight and quit wasting peoples time.

53cWelhf43lMCFQPVH5_yQ.text: We have been to Inchin Bamboo many times since they opened last year. Last night was a disappointing experience. The waiter was pushy and kept asking the kids to be quiet, while he was taking the order.As soon as we sat down, went and pushed the Japanese Whisky, if we ask for recommendation than suggest. He kept pushing one of the ladies in the group to buy a drink 4-5 times. Lastly the food was ordinary this time, appetizers were okay but the curry fried rice was disappointing. When you charge 18% gratuity, you better provide the service. I did enjoy the green mango drink.

gexn9GEnNHRFKgqxUPOKEQ.text: Nice ambiance and good lunch specials. And food tastes good. We ordered Thai chicken it was really good

TTY8Tnx75zVPiIr6YdCPUw.text: Terrible service.  Ordered 2 items (chicken manchurian and burnt garlic fried rice).  Took forever to get food (45min-1 hour).  The kid at the table beside us was crying she was so hungry and the food was taking so long.  They brought out our chicken and the rice didn't come until we were half done with the chicken.  I also got a to go order for lunch the next day and when I opened it today the rice container was only half full.  What a rip off.  We will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States

g3Dk6TaO4DWrLVM9Pbbefg.text: Overrated place. Waited 15 mins to just be put on the list to be seated (there was noone at the front desk) waited 20 more mins to be seated (just a party of 3)...and i dont even know how long it took for the food to arrive...took forever. All dishes had a mediocre taste...paneer chili fry was rock hard..and the hakka noodles had no flavor at all! Pls improve your customer service and food quality to retain customers.

sHKNf--tbc4JCkSs_P9SFw.text: So far the experience with this restaurant has been great! In my last visit one of the dishes we had ordered was super spicy but when I asked the server about it, they replaced it with a milder dish of my choice. The restaurant manager Clinton repeatedly checked on us and in fact also gave a mango mojito complimentary. Nice experience overall!

v2pRAqewzPrsDW4t1p0rlQ.text: The restaurant is super unprofessional. The waiter didn't start the drink at the first. When we asked the drink option, he thought we just want water. I don't know if this is just laziness or the mistake. Then, the other waiter keep mess up the dishes we order. At last, the waiter didn't ask if we want separate check or together check and give us a together check for 9 people. The server is not polite at all. No please, no thank you. However, they still force us for tips. The dishes is really salty and not tasty. The overall experience is not pleasant. I don't recommend this restaurant.

3nNGcSLmeg9HuHmEutjY8w.text: Great ambience and decor! And the food is delicious. Pan fried fish, street side Indian noodles, hongkong chicken are a few names to start with !

eYlH5dN5BhvPnJzOAWYDpA.text: We went for a second time this evening at the start of dinner. The manager was the only one on the floor (what happened to all of the servers?). Once we got the menus, it took him a while to come back and take our order, including our drinks. I ordered the Hong Kong chicken and my boyfriend ordered the lamb bulgogi. His order came out wrong. They brought him the lamb hot garlic. No one ever came back to check on us, and we were hungry, so we ended up eating what we could. My Hong Kong chicken was very disappointing. The texture of the chicken (minced) was very rubbery. I am usually not a picky eater, but I couldn't bring myself to take more than 2 bites. The manager did offer us 25% off our ticket, which was a nice gesture. But unfortunately, I don't think I will be returning anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot garlic beef (lunch portion) &amp; lamb bulgogi
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken 65

skEr41EUnPmDBW2jW1WP_Q.text: Me and my friends were super excited to go to this place as all of us love Indo-Chinese but it was a complete disappointment . Everything we ordered was served cold , soup had too much salt , appetizers were served after the entrees. We had to  send almost everything to reheat .  Munchurian came first although it was hot but we had to wait for noodles for 15 min . It is on the expensive side . Portions served are kind of ok not too much . Staff was good . They tried to make us happy by offering some discount but mood gets spoilt with bad food .

3PkWbS1RIV37P9U4gXr15Q.text: We went here on Saturday night they were busy . We sat down ordered our food we were in and out in literally 45 min . There  food was excellent . We ordered paneer Taco, pan fried chili paneer, vegetable dumplings and schezwan rice . Excellent service

F5K8cVyT7yFrzCF5UsMdjQ.text: I have visited them twice. First on Feb 14th when it was too crowded and we got a table 30 mins before their kitchen would actually close. The appetizers was good and we ordered the main course as well as the desserts well in advance before their kitchen closing time. After waiting for close to 15-20 mins, the desserts came out without the entrees. Finally when the food arrived it was tasteless. Now, I went again yesterday to give them a second chance to prove themselves. The soup came in after the appetizers. We ordered chilly chicken and it was so hot that after one bite, my mouth kind a got burned. The manager was saying that since it's chilly chicken it will be hot but it should not be too hot like insanity. Horrible food and service. Not recommended at all.

EXsHB2dbsPuSrsxwU9X8Ew.text: This was my first experience with this chain and I'm sorry to say it was not a good one. The food was okay, the waitstaff alright, but overall I felt very uncomfortable eating here. The managers were hovering most of the time. I'm not sure if they were trying to help the one girl waiting tables out, or if they were just making it harder for her. But we were approached by three different managers during our visit for various reasons. They all spoke very quietly so I could barely hear them, even though the restaurant itself was not busy and was very quiet. I can see why a new restaurant like this was so quiet at dinner time on a Saturday.   I ordered szcheuan shrimp, which is fairly spicy, so I didn't notice at first that my food wasn't hot temperature wise. It was still edible and I was starving, so I ate it. I also wasn't expecting the shrimp to be fried and it was pretty disappointing that they were. This is because the Szcheuan sauce was very soupy, so the batter soaked it up and made the shrimp soggy. They were also too big to put in your mouth and no knives were provided. I ended up getting sauce on my white shirt because the shrimp were hard to maneuver. The sauce itself basically tasted like the brown sauce you'd typically find at a Chinese place, but with extra chili oil in it. So, not great for $18.   I also ordered the fruit cocktail sundae, which was also alright, but not worth $5. The sundae was made of very cheap vanilla ice cream, cheap canned fruit cocktail (so cheap there weren't even cherries in it), and yellow cake that tasted more like a corn muffin than cake.   The waitstaff was competent, but would disappear for long periods of time. Luckily, they serve their water in a stoppered bottle so you can pour it yourself so I didn't have to wait to have my water glass refilled until the bottle was empty. However, because it was in a bottle, it was not at all cold. They apparently haven't heard of ice either unless you order soda or tea (cool thing to note: they use paper straws!).   Back to the waitstaff, the managers kept approaching to ask if things were alright and how the food was (would have been totally fine with that if not for the fact the waitress had done the same thing not two minutes prior). It was like the managers were trying to do the waiters' job and then didn't inform them they were doing so, as a manager took our payment and returned our card, and then the waitress came by a moment later to do the same. I also had a plate of finished food sitting in front of me for the duration of my dessert because the waitress decided to leave it after she put my dessert down. Did I neglect to mention our waitress also didn't know what was in the food?  Overall, this place is not only too expensive for the area, it's also just not good at all. 0/10 do not recommend.

udnsjEjsdb_DHyz1-JCvUg.text: Amazing flavours for Indian crowd,  I visit here very frequently with my husband. Never leave disappointed :)

dwR_sXv-0mneVjTCtjeGlQ.text: Good place for some Indo-Chinese food. Loved their street side chow mein and chicken 65. Definitely a must try. Good service.

8EWpfeSls1LCnkdXcQvsrA.text: Employees at this places are the sweetest. I love them so much. We accidentally ordered something really spicy so they us pastries for free. I love this place. The food was fabulous and I have been craving for there food for the longest time!! I just can't wait to go back to this place soon!!

7QBXZO4-ZBcelPVQ6-JLnw.text: I visited Inchin Bamboo garden last week.The taste and the flavors are promising.It has great ambience and I look forward to coming back.

yXWtkJzbvcN3TO8GQEXSTQ.text: Taste : they are ok, but service is what needs a heavy improvement.  They are Snail pace in service : for instance soup was served after the food:-) . They are just one week old .. may be they will soon ramp up. Will surely give a try next time in couple of weeks.

5IKFfgxDG42G_-4M470HQw.text: This place--as of this writing--currently has three and a half stars, which I think is not fair. It's a great place. Really nice decor and ambiance. Service was very good. And most importantly, the food was delicious! If you like Chinese and/or spicy and/or Indian, it's a must-go.

R6ttPbXII0MtNypGogecsQ.text: Good service nice ambience very polite service and attentive towards customer service.  Tasty food perfect flavor will be back definitely

eunCKN3UkzVGmXLQFbk6iA.text: Please avoid this restaurant whenever you are in this area. I ordered food to go and not only did they forget a part of my order, they sent the food without utensils and all the food was too spicy. We called ahead of time to gauge the flavor of the food and unfortunately we were misguided. When I called to see if i could get refunded I was given a hard time. Unfortunate for a restaurant like this.

vT2OSF1gUNWweDMVfnerow.text: Authentic Indo-Chinese !!! Good quality ingredients and the food was well prepared.....   People with low spice threshold - be careful since most of the dishes are a spicy (which is a good thing for me though !!)  Service could be better.

d3wvWRopJY-w5-hr4HWQMQ.text: I was the first customer at this restaurant and on the first day the food was OK. However, my love for Indo Chinese food brought me back to this place again. My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed all the appetizers. In the main course; however, all the different curries ultimately had the same taste. You couldn't tell the difference between Szechwan sauces versus the Manchurian vs the garlic. I'm attaching all the pictures with this message. The lettuce with the Paneer tacos was old and turning yellow-ish. The desserts were really good. I highly recommend the chocolate spring rolls and the chocolate mousse cake !! I would come back and recommend this place but the service needs to get better. It is slow maybe due to still hiring process in this new restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. #tasteless Mango Mojito
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States

y6nLFT3U79WVfkwTV5f_ew.text: We were a party of 16 people including kids, with such a big crowd i was amazed with the hospitality shown by delivering delicious food on time. I am from hyderabad and this food reminded me about the food we had at Alex's kitchen which is one of the famous Indo-chinese @ Himayatnagar. Let me start with Mojitos, the Far East Move and Phuket were excellent !! Cocktails were mixed up right. Coming to appetizers, Volcano shrimp and chicken 65 were the best. Main entrees, loved the house chicken fried, chilli garlic noodles and American chopsey. Kids enjoyed the Szechwan dumplings.The food here is fresh and 100% satisfies the Indian tastes buds. I strongly recommend this place!!!

ELR7xfWOXufHb5Ucn7hLXA.text: One of the worst experiences I've had in a restaurant ever. After sitting at our table for a solid 25 minutes, the waiter finally decided to come and take our order. After we ordered our dinner, we didn't see our waiter for the next 30 minutes. We had to remind him that we were still sitting in the restaurant. After he acknowledged our existence, we FINALLY received our food, but it was ice cold.   The food was disastrously under seasoned, and the sauce that they used was the same across THREE dishes. It felt as if we were eating a cold water soup with croutons.   I have eaten at the Cary branch before and had a wonderful experience; however, I was nothing but dissatisfied with my experience here.

IWBGwougpZqP9tOlHrTQDQ.text: Tried a 2nd time, This time for lunch. NO crazy crowd this time around, none in fact, But still we got the same Crappy service. Last time we were here it was an evening and it was crowded. I understand the glitch in service with a heavy crowd. But the 2nd time was ridiculous. We waited for more than 30 mins for a Baby corn fry, ended up cancelling the order.   They spoil the mood and feel like you are eating there for free.   Food: 4/5 Service: 0/5.

RcHey7DPdb-XX3hd_VX50g.text: We went to Inchin's Bamboo Garden for the third time this Thursday. When we arrived the place was bustling. We were greeted and seated promptly.  Within moments of being seated, our waiter greeted us and brought us water. He came back to get our drink orders, and then when he brought the drinks from the bar, he took our appetizer and entree orders. The pace of the meal flowed nicely and we never felt rushed.  We ordered vegetable tulips and lat mai paneer to start and for the main course we each ordered a spicy thai basil rice and street side chow mein.   Both the vegetable tulips and lat mai paneer were excellent. Very fresh and made to perfection.   We also loved our entrees. They were huge and we took over half home.   Overall, we enjoyed all 3 of our experiences at Inchin's. Their menu was extensive and the food exceeded our expectations every time we visited them. They also have nice drinks, dessert and kids menu. Also, the price is quite reasonable. Can't wait to go back!

O85HD-AQMSussQZQMsw0Jg.text: If you want to eat lot of MSG then go to this place. If you guys don't know what MSG do to your body then google it please. Every dish they are preparing has that bitter taste of MSG and overwhelming high sodium soy sauce I will never go to this place ever and don't recommend to anyone. If you want to stay healthy definitely stay away. They should be shut down because of there food preparation. If you guys don't believe then do random tests on there dishes.

U3wrF8Ib3prsLueCIYe9uQ.text: Just had the Crispy Chili Honey chicken from here. It came with white rice, however I prefer fried rice but they said they don't serve fried rice after lunch. The chicken was was really good however it was a little too spicy and I actually like spicy food. So beware if you are not into spicy foods. I also had the spring rolls which were really good. Definitely will return but will try to order something a little less spicy.

RWMwe8-HJL6Wjy1KZiBoWQ.text: The service was pathetic. We ordered honey chicken and the dish lacked any seasoning. They refused to change that stating because it is honey chicken they did not add any salt to it. It was not at all worth the money..

2renR1GASDd0bSmc2kylzA.text: Recommended by a friend, ordered noodles and oreintal briyani. Both were pathetic, I could make better food in one or 2 attempts. The price also not very attractive, one disappointing experience.

EloE1QbXiH-82VKX8_I0dQ.text: I guess I'll be the first to review! First, I'm going to say "Thank You" for bringing something fresh and unique to the University Area! Second, I think it was awesome that this place provided the community with free lunch on opening day! This was a great way to show appreciation for future clientele!   I made sure to take advantage of this free lunch, and I was not disappointed. I had the Beef Mongolian and it was great. It was served with a healthy portion of fried rice and a side "salad" which was actually kimchi! All in all, the dish had a great flavor profile, and was enhanced by the different sauces they had table side.   I didn't get a chance to look at their full menu, but I must say I have high expectations now! The ambiance is really cool. Very intimate and romantic. Also, I love their decorations that pay homage to Buddhism.  I will definitely be back!

WKdNMOeFp0-9pccQBEKTzQ.text: You have to go to this place to try Chinese-fusion cuisine.  We have a very sweet server who helped us in selecting a few items as per our preference and spice tolerance.  All the servers are very sweet and friendly. Try the sweet corn soup , chicken manchurian if is very soft and not too spicy. American chopsuey is also one of our favorites.  Thank you Inchin Bamboo Garden for great service and food )

6HrY8oaiARwPGV74Gry6ng.text: This is the best Indian Pakistani Chinese food restaurant. Very fine setting, high quality ingredients, great ambiance and a perfect blend of quality and service. I'm really not understanding why half the people are complaining about the spice level because they literally ask you to give a spicy level between 1-10. Guys expect to get spicy food if you come to an Asian restaurant. As far as the service, I'm shocked at some of the reviews about the creepy servers. All the servers and the long hair pony tailed manager Clinton are probably the best in the entire food industry, extremely personable and go above and beyond to help. Mistakes happen with everyone and when there was the occasional soup flavor mixup they gave us the extra soups for no charge. The staff knows us on a first name basis and goes out of the way to promptly help all customers. This is a place where you can proudly take your wife, in-laws, coworkers and executives (done all that and received raving positive reviews, every single person was impressed). The ambiance, service, high quality you will get here is unmatched in any indo pak or any other restaurant. We are so blessed to have this restaurant in Charlotte and could not be more appreciative. If any of you have any questions please message me. I'm usually not the one to write a ton of reviews, I wish I could give 10 stars out of 5. This is the restaurant I proudly celebrate all our birthdays, anniversaries and major life milestones. Beats PF Chang's, Bone Fish Grill etc..btw the deserts are world class, and the food is just as great, and they are so caring and don't hesitate to go above and beyond to ensure you are satisfied.

IGJTfdzSeTivw7aLDyRXQA.text: Ordered trough uber eats it took longer than expected for the food to be delivered.. spicy paneer taco looked yuck taste and presentation wise.. tamato soup was red colour water..  hot n sour soup was like uncooked soya sauce.. Chilli garlic noodles was tasteless and oily..  Bag say u will find your lost appetite in the bag infact i lost appetite after eating this.. spoiled my weekend mood.. not coming back to this place.

tvTZMHxDG1b69GKkH__R_Q.text: Authentic indo - chinese taste. I went with family and quantity served in entrees is good. Staff is attentive and gave their suggestions too. We have lived in many cities in US and found this place to be among the better ones. The non-veg starters were great. The kids entrees do need more variety.

8XaofMDNb7A_CjGwaGLuSQ.text: Service is not at all good. We called to book the table in advance but no one  picked the call . We reached the hotel and they told wait time is 20 mins. Even after one hour we didn't get the table. Ended up in moving to other restaurant.

CSwiw8voi1t_nu4zgiMYdA.text: Amazing restaurant and service. To be honest, this indo Chinese food is better than the one I had in India. That says it all I think. And service is always amazing since they would customize the dishes in whatever way you want. I'd definitely recommend this place.

4MfsyvORhtVq2HVWx_sHuQ.text: This is probably best indo Chinese restaurant in town, it has nice ambience and decor.  Chili garlic noodles and chicken 65 are my favorite, I will be visiting more often.

05Mv5TuXhSYBFq1D1d8q6Q.text: This was our first time coming to this restaurant and it was awesome! The staff was very attentive. The environment was smoke free and comfortable. Our food did not take long to arrive. Everything was as if it just came off the fire. The waiter was kind enough to let us sample some of the juice offered and brought us a complimentary dessert. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a wonderful dining experience.

3wRY3GqnhdjgWnsH-s-H6A.text: Love the place, the food ! If u love Indio Chinese this is the place ..momos, dumplings awesome ! but the Chinese bhel and fried ice cream can be improvised. All together a good place to satisfy your taste buds for Indo Chinese cuisine.. highly recommended!!!

_bxIjIeEFNK_4KFoY5xEfg.text: My friends have been raving about this place every since it opened up so I figured let me check it out and see what the fuss is all about so I came here for late lunch with couple of friends. This is a new place so all the decor looks very modern and fresh. I hope it stays that way even after years to come.   My friend is a big fan of this place so as we get here, he is being treated as a royalty. We get to pick where we want to seat, our favorite waiter who knows their stuff not just a pretty face and the manager came to greet us and check on us few times while we were here. Now that's called personal attention to their customers.   We started our order with drinks and they were able to bring it right away. While we were catching up, my friend ordered some food which arrived in short time. The food tasted good but the sweet and spicy sauce made it even better for my taste.   We really enjoyed our visit here with their excellent service, great food and personal attention to details on our request for special drinks and food (spicy). We will definitely come here often.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States

jhcPN5lIVFO7dAH89rxzXg.text: One of the finest Indo-Chinese restaurants we have been so far.  Pros Great menu for appetizers We just took one entree(Hakka noodle) and it was great. Great cocktail drinks (never seen this many awesome cocktail menu ever. Kudos for that) Great ambiance Great service (George, who helped us with menu and drinks is an awesome gentleman and he is one behind the bar as well, who made my drink. Top notch drink.) Price is worth based on the quality of food, service and especially the whole set up. Plenty of car parking space   Cons There should be More variety of items on desert menu.   I truly recommend this place and highly appreciate

IqYQ2G8wRdKRpQ_1mcuUUw.text: Horrible service.. totally unprofessional.. not at all clean.. I wish I could award negative stars.. if you call ahead they do not pick up... always under staffed.. taste is very poor.. not like how it used to be..

m1v1wFuRSMK6RYY9dM-SBg.text: Finally there's a Bamboo Garden in Charlotte and I don't have to the Triangle any more!! Tried this place yesterday for lunch. The food is just as good if not better than the other location. They have really good lunch specials. I had the chicken manchurian with chicken fried rice and Hakka noodles. Lunch specials come with a spring roll, soup and kimchi. My husband had the garlic paneer. I also ordered a mango mojito (non-alcoholic) and we shared the darsaan dessert (fried noodles with sesame and honey and vanilla ice cream. I wasn't too crazy about the drink but everything else was top notch! The drinks looked phenomenal but since we went here for lunch during work hours, I decided to pass on the alcohol. But I will be having some tonight if we go again. The other location has crispy chili baby corn which I didn't think to look up but if you see it on the mit's a must-have.  Our food arrived in a timely manner and was very well presented. Service was great and the decor is very tastefully done. They have ample parking.  I am SO stoked to see this place finally open (the signs have been up since summer). Can't wait to go here again this weekend. Maybe I'll make this a weekly thing?

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Date wontons with vanilla ice cream.
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hong Kong chicken. Milder but flavorful.
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic paneer

3UXfenBNnFJ6hRFvLw80lA.text: I don't even know what to say. Serves needs major work. Our waiter was super creepy and didn't listen to anything we said. We had to repeat ourselves three times before he was able to repeat back to us what we order because we didn't want him to get our order wrong. HINT HINT WRITE IT DOWN! I got the salt and pepper chicken. It was bitter. I don't even know why it was bitter. Rice was hard as hell. Probably never going back. First time was a mistake. Food and served was horrible. I work in the restaurant business for 8 years, so I'm not saying this because I'm privileged, I saying this because I have experience.

GasW6D6aIgPbY3S3-_GACA.text: Inchin has been a favorite of our extended family, and they continue to deliver with great taste and an excellent ambience! Presentation of the dishes and the warmth of the staff are key to having us keep going back, in addition to an eclectic mix of Indian, Chinese and mysterious other flavors!! They were especially kind last night when we had mixed up our order by ensuring we left only satisfied with our meal! Kudos to the staff of Inchin, Charlotte !

wlB3268TK5CQjkwegnMo6w.text: Food is good .., but service is extremely disappointing. When we arrived, we were told that the waiting time is 20 mins. We waited for an hour and still we didn't get the table. We were checking with them every 5 mins, and we didn't get a proper response at all. After a little over an hour, stepped out and went to another restaurant. I don't think we will come back to this restaurant ever again. They have decent food but they can't serve it! It's a pity

Yxe321-6rdQFdXoWUGyGRg.text: This was my first time here.  It was a recommendation from a friend.  I'm originally from NJ and the food around other parts is usually hard to top.  Bamboo Garden did not disappoint!  The ambiance and the service were great.  I ordered the Gobi Manchurian, Chicken 65 and Dumplings.  All were great, but the Gobi Manchurian was my favorite.  Will definitely return when I'm in town.

0h2rZZk-yfrodR4i2ORcCQ.text: Four for atmosphere and three for food, so I would give it a 3.5 if I could.  My sweet and sour chicken with veggies and pineapple was just not tart enough.  I wasn't sensing the abundant flavors that sweet and sour dishes normally have.   The chicken was good.   Service was also good.   It annoyed me that a random man came by our table, trying to sell us a gift card to the restaurant.  He said that if we bought one, he would add an extra $15 to it.  This seemed rather suspicious to me and I certainly was not entertaining the idea of a quick return trip there.  Big turn off!  The restaurant was filled with Indian people, which was a decent indicator that the place is highly thought of by loyal patrons.   The bar was alluring with fascinating pieces of art all around it.  Best part of the evening was visiting with Sasirekha and her mother and taking my mom with us to celebrate Mother's Day.   My mom would have actually  preferred a steak and a plate of French fries, but tomorrow is another opportunity to please.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States

vA6d5gX8QHGZfnwWwsDC0Q.text: Excellent ambience and food.  The menu has a wide variety of dishes including ample gluten free options.  The happy hour deals include reduced price drinks and appetizers.  Great service also!   will definitely come again!

Pvn6SZ61UmF1EVEaaGmovw.text: Beautifully decorated restaurant in the University Area.  Located in a shopping center so parking can be dicey depending on the day or time.  Ordered my food go, but in the time I was there I could see they are still working out the kinks for serving and customer service.  The food was really great even in a to go fashion.  Packed nicely and everything was fresh and hot.  The salt and pepper shrimp really yum, the lamb bugoli super yummy(think of Mongolian beef just made with lamb, and chocolate mousse desert was divine.  The only thing I would not order again was the hot and sour soup-kinda blah.  Otherwise I will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb bugoli, hot and sour soup, and salt and pepper shrimp.  The soup was the only disappointment.  The rest was super good!
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love the to go bag
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Picking up my first takeout..review to follow

RlbC9mYbpuKWBIFfJyWmqw.text: Amazing flavors ,Indian street food reinvented in UsA. Most of the dishes can be customized for different spice levels and turns out to be great ,me and my partner we like to visit here often and we take it as a safe bet when we have over Indian friends invited for treat or casual dinner outing .

h7ct2vg5aOBeeMz_uNjedA.text: Awesome food and service.  Liked their new ribbon potato entree as an appetizer. Went there on weekday night and were pleasantly surprised by food quality and service.  Must try

vqXGaPIOZ77akSt6MgB-JQ.text: Great Ambiance, and awesome customer service compared to any other Indian restaurant in Charlotte area. There will be wait time on weekends just be prepared to wait 45 minutes and trust me its worth the wait. Things to try Sweet Corn Soup Cauliflower Manchurian Vegetable Coins  Paneer with schezwan gravy  Please ask for recommendation before ordering, it might not be what you want.

3OydJkjAUs5ja1fKcIxsFQ.text: The food, service and ambience ... exceptional experience overall.    Indo-Chinese cuisine is NOT Chinese, it's NOT Indian as we know it.  It's a specific genre that's unique to India.  Forged by the spices and stories of Chinese immigrants to India over many centuries, this cuisine is unique and unlike any other.    If you have tasted the best Indo Chinese east of the Atlantic, you know that Inchin Bamboo Garden is the best west of the pond.   Their food used to be 3 or 4 at best.  They have upped the game to a solid 5/5.  Hope they keep it up.   Note - spice level is high.  Medium is equivalent to hot elsewhere.  We stick with mild.

jatUH67XZM9BhYUBptWyAw.text: If you are looking for True indo- Chinese, this is the place for you! Good ambiance, good service, great food !  My fav was their chili garlic sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb momos!

lNAYVs50j1UEHtp8CxTOjw.text: I wish I could give no star but I had to give one to write my review: on Tuesday I arriving with my work friend for lunch at 11.30 after brain seated we got our sweet corn soup which was only few corn with a paddle of cornflour, salad which was a bad replica of khimchi & spring Role which was edible Then we kept waiting for almost 30-35 minutes looking for someone to take our order,the order arrive to us after another 30 mins by reminding the wait staff. The wait staff even asked how the food was & I had hesitation to say but the food was horrible & after getting the review the wait staff brings the check with no apology. That was the 1st & last experience of this place. Please don't wade your money here rathe go to any other Chinese Restaurent which are much tastier & the services are good.

QOZxIWCBDp3HIzYPlpzN4w.text: The food was NOT worth the ammonia you spend on it. My friends and I went here the other night and we got paneer tacos, fried rice, chili paneer, and veggie Chow mein the food took FOREVER to come out and it wasn't even busy and when it did it was nothing to brag about. The fried rice and noodles weren't that good I could get better from a take out place for WAY cheaper, the chili paneer was pretty good but there just wasn't enough for four people and same with the paneer tacos they were so good but you get 3 and they're so small!! It's honestly not worth the price you pay for the food. Might as well go to a takeout place and save your money!

8lOMW2iTLNodQVOKKEzycQ.text: Awesome food great service like the dumplings and craft cocktail ambience is nice very nice selection of drinks overall wonderful experience nice decor peaceful music Thanks for giving wonderful indo Chinese cuisine in charlotte  Will be back soon

UljXdRQWuMKrUCHB9ix9eA.text: I love the food here. If my husband could eat here everyday, he would.   Love the garlic fried rice. The appetizers are great and the fact that there's unusual things I've never had, it made me happy. By unusual, I mean like an ethnic mash up of Indian and Chinese foods.   The only thing is that the prices are kind of high, but the food is amazing.

KK3QfZq7Zx8Smn3mvq-hWg.text: How did I not know about this place sooner?! Cocktails were AMAZING and so creative. The ambiance was wonderful. Very relaxing. The food was absolutely delicious. Even something as simple as garlic noodles was so flavorful and well balanced. We also tried the green curry, chili honey eggplant, Kung Pao chicken, yellow curry, and burnt chili fried rice. Omg everything was good!! I'm impressed and will be back soon. What a great evening.   Did I mention TONS of vegan options too??

GIKvcz4Z1QiAN0tJNoZCIw.text: Enjoyed a wonderful dinner tonight . Tucked in a corner in a small shopping center in the university area , I was surprised how beautiful the interior of the restaurant was . Perfect ambiance for  a large dinner party . The menu had a variety of vegetarian and non vegetarian options. I tried several appetizers , main courses and dessert . Everything was delicious and   flavorful. The manchow soup was full of fresh herbs , can't wait to enjoy it on an upcoming cold night. The five spice lamb was served super cute on a grill platter with candles , definitely instagram worthy . We ended the meal with some green tea , and date wontons , A very delicious twist on a crab rangoon style dessert .  Where the filing is  a date mixture instead of cream cheese .  Definitely a go to spot for your next lunch or dinner  outing .

e3SSiQqiowmX2HvWGLUizg.text: The food is tasty and definitely unique for the Charlotte area. Service is always excellent. If it was closer to where we live, we would definitely go more often.

BbB7k0bXBwVIuDe_CUOvTA.text: Gotta agree with my Yelp pal Michael W who says, "four [stars] for atmosphere and three for food, so I would give it a 3.5 if I could."  This is my second visit for lunch; once, for takeout and today to sit down.  The place looks closed until you get right up to the door, and both visits very few patrons.  Better signage would help, I'm sure.  We both ordered the Szechuan Lamb which comes with soup, choice of rice, and a bowl of lamb stew.  While it was spicy as advertised, I thought the flavors were muddled, caught in the culinary confluence somewhere between India and China, hence their name.  Corn soup was poorly conceived and was bland, and thick like paste.  Pass.  We also shared their Thai Asian salad which was very good.  It included chicken which we learned at checkout was a $2 up charge even though we did not request it.  Bummer.  I think if you're into their Indo-China concept you may like it.   If so, give 'em a whirl.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Szechuan Lamb with vegetable rice lunch entrée, $11 .

4Y6i237vEpf5tRM_OmBWLA.text: This is my fourth visit @ this location. I tried something different which is 5 species lamb. I liked it because of subtle flavor and presentation is unique. Just check the pics yours and I am sure you will love food and presentation too

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States

DBuLPQ_UtpbHJVX7Mlrh3w.text: It was my first time here in Charlotte and it has already become my favourite place to eat. I had Paneer chilli which was really good, I could actually feel the indo-chinese flavour. Then we had garlic chilli noodles and Gobi manchurian with fried rice (which was really good. It was not that spicy as I imagined but it was good. Overall I was satisfied by the food.  UPDATE 02/27/2019  Menu: Every time I come here, the food and service is worse than previous time. (This visit was my 5th one) First of all their menu changes every time I go there. This time I went and ordered Dumplings and they served half the quantity they used to serve and they said they've updated the way they serve food.  Food: Food was just not good it was bland and had less salt. All Asian fusions have an option of giving fried rice for some extra bucks but Here there is No such option and we have to get an entire entree of Fried rice.  Service: There were 2 of us and we ordered 2 soups. They served us only one and after 15 minutes served another. The place was 15% filled yet no one was there to follow up. We had to go to the bar just to ask for basic things such as salt and pepper.

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gobi Manchurian. The machurian had become soggy but the gravy was tasty.
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paneer chilli. Was really spicy and flavourful.
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chilli Garlic Noodles. It was medium spicy but tasted really good.

HUqE3bFIAiQ2uDQbSJB7oA.text: This was a suggestion by a friend that lives in the area.  5 stars & I will definitely be back.   Close to UNCC & close to Concord Mills.

mVrHFM--01v8ExOrlnilGg.text: Friday - feb 1st  Worst experience.... waited 20 min to order food and then waited 70 min for the food  Overrated place ... surprised to see 3.5 stars  Below average food...

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. After waiting almost 90 min..Was served cold chicken...We had to step out immediately   Hope some inspection is done on this place

2uiZlY1UnTSeM_ENw18P2Q.text: So this is our first time coming to bamboo garden and I believe it'll be the last. So far we had the momos and they were decent. Our waiter however, I'm not sure if he is 1)High? 2) Tired? Or 3) Just Rude ?  Or all of the above but his attitude from jump has been quite unpleasant. Very dry and rude not very welcoming. My husband was ordering his food and in the middle of asking if he could substitute white rice for brown but , before he could even get his words out the waiter was talking over him saying "We do not substitute".  Idk despite the crappy customer service reviews we decided to try this place anyway but yeah na we are good won't be returning here.  The inside is pretty but the food is a NO , the customer service is a NO NO and the prices is a NO NO NO!  Update: Maybe the waiter saw me typing this review because he asked if everything was good and I politely told him no. He then brought us a brownie and ice cream "on the house" well thank you sir it was good and I appreciate it but I still will not be returning

hKWcgWt9RAqLH-2aeBT_zg.text: Best place in town for indo chinese dishes like hakka noodles, spring rolls and fried rice.  Especially do not miss Chicken Thai curry Things you will definitely love - Nice Ambience, Friendly staff and Customer service

0Td0yGTuUyaz0p1WdtVOFQ.text: This is the second restaurant to offer indo-chinese food in the city of Charlotte and is a chain. In my experience the food can be hit or miss. I have dines in during both lunch and dinner and found the food taste to be inconsistent which I am not a fan of. The menu is huge and in my two visits thus far, I have tired Paneer Latmai, chilli paneer, hakka noodles, Manchurian, burnt garlic fried rice and dimsums. My all time favorite is burnt garlic fried rice. I will visit again to satisfy my cravings for indian Chinese food

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt garlic fried rice
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Manchurian
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chilli paneer

UbndwC_TFjjKsqhjjpGZ6w.text: I've been to the Inchin's in Cleveland, OH and loved it. Halal, Chinese-Asian fusion and delicious! What more could you ask for?! Came here with friends, it's always a good sign when an Asian restaurant is full of brown people! For starters had the momo. They are more like pot stickers but good nonetheless. Have them with the momo sauce, nice and spicy! The chili paneer- oh how I have been craving this! It was delicious! Had some bird's eye chillies in it that were hot and so good with the paneer! We then had the manchow soup, which was very different but in a good way! For entrees we had the general tso's chicken - I found it kinda sweet but was flavorful Mongolian lamb was a bit tough but nicely spiced. Cumin lamb was delicious! It's new on the menu. I've missed having it! We also tried the crispy chicken chili honey - I liked it way more than the general tso's! I also had the Desi mango drink - with black salt, was pretty good!  I was kinda disappointed with their dessert options! I expected some desi desserts but nope!  All in all I loved it and am looking forward to coming here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili fried fish was so good
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paneer 65 was delicious!
Photo of Inchin's Bamboo Garden - Charlotte, NC, United States. Manchow soup - different but good!

JMjjvtyLAr_BZkQBUsBLYg.text: It's been a long pending review to this amazing place. First of all thanks to the management for bringing IBG to Charlotte. Been here multiple times and always had a good experience. Great ambiance with tasty food and wonderful staff makes it my to-go spot. My personal favorites are the soups, street side chow mein , chicken 65 fried rice and the garlic pepper chicken.

KgO5xQBA7NY8vhjQamJ-Hw.text: My husband is a big fan of this place and he introduced me to this Indo Chinese restaurant. I have tried this restaurant both in Charlotte and Bellevue and lived the food at both places. Noodle bhel is a must try. It's almost like the bhel served in India except for the fact that in India it's served with puff rice and here they are crispy fried noodles. I always have the paneer starter which is coated in loads of spicy and is just mouth watering. Reminds me of the taste in India. Egg chowmein is my husband's all time favorite and trust me it's the street style chowmein of India and the best dish in the menu. I had tried spicy egg plant stir fry and I swear it was the best egg plant dish I ever had with loads of garlic and juicy egg plants. My husband's friend from NYC joined us for dinner here while visiting Bellevue and he loved the Indo Chinese food here too. If you are missing the Indo Chinese Indian food then you must visit this place for sure!
